snippet: The viral media site will use a $50 million investment to diversify its content, expand its video arm and create an in-house incubator for new technology.
abstract: Viral media site BuzzFeed will use a $50 million investment from venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz to diversify its content, expand its video arm and create an in-house incubator for new technology; question remains whether site, with 150 million average monthly viewers, can maintain agility and skills of tech start-up while building breadth of large media company.
lead_paragraph: The viral media site will use a $50 million investment to diversify its content, expand its video arm and create an in-house incubator for new technology.

headline.main: 50 Million New Reasons BuzzFeed Wants to Take Its Content Far Beyond Lists
headline.print_headline: A Push to Go Beyond Lists for Content at BuzzFeed
